item.title: babyhippoface add a quote by Jim Elliot
item.description: "Lord, make my way prosperous not that I achieve high station, but that my life be an exhibit to the value of knowing God." -- Jim Elliot

item.title: babyhippoface add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: babyhippoface add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "Beautiful young people are accidents of nature, but beautiful old people are works of art. " -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: babyhippoface add a quote by Frances O'Roark Dowell
item.description: "Everybody's broken, sweetie. God helps us get put back together. ~Rev. Mayes <i>The Kind of Friends We Used to Be</i>" -- Frances O'Roark Dowell

item.title: babyhippoface add a quote by Arnold Lobel
item.description: "You can keep your willpower, Frog. I am going home to bake a cake." -- Arnold Lobel

item.title: babyhippoface add a quote by Scott Alexander
item.description: "All good is hard. All evil is easy. Dying, losing, cheating, and mediocrity are easy. Stay away from easy." -- Scott Alexander

item.title: babyhippoface add a quote by Katrina Gutleben
item.description: "Learning can only happen when a child is interested. If he’s not interested it’s like throwing marshmallows at his head and calling it eating." -- Katrina Gutleben

item.title: babyhippoface add a quote by Austin Kleon
item.description: "You don’t get to pick your family, but you can pick your teachers and you can pick your friends and you can pick the music you listen to and you can pick the books you read and you can pick the movies you see. You are, in fact, a mashup of what you choose to let into your life. You are the sum of your influences. The German writer Goethe said, "We are shaped and fashioned by what we love." -- Austin Kleon

item.title: babyhippoface add a quote by Norton Juster
item.description: "The only thing you can do easily is be wrong, and that's hardly worth the effort." -- Norton Juster

item.title: babyhippoface add a quote by Gary D. Schmidt
item.description: "Mr. Powell raised an eyebrow. 'I'm a librarian,' he said. 'I always know what I'm talking about." -- Gary D. Schmidt

item.title: babyhippoface add a quote by Augusten Burroughs
item.description: "I myself am made entirely of flaws, stitched together with good intentions." -- Augusten Burroughs

item.title: babyhippoface add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "A children's story that can only be enjoyed by children is not a good children's story in the slightest." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: babyhippoface add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Be sure you put your feet in the right place, then stand firm." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: babyhippoface add a quote by Lou Holtz
item.description: "Your talent determines what you can do. Your motivation determines how much you are willing to do. Your attitude determines how well you do it." -- Lou Holtz

item.title: babyhippoface add a quote by Art Linkletter
item.description: "Things turn out best for the people who make the best out of the way things turn out" -- Art Linkletter

item.title: babyhippoface add a quote by .---David Petete
item.description: "One lone act by a righteous man which betrays his moral standards does not define him anymore than an act of kindness perpetrated by the most evil of all men tells you what is in his heart" -- .---David Petete

item.title: babyhippoface add a quote by Stephanie Harvey
item.description: "Libraries should be the beating heart of the school, not mausoleums for dusty books." -- Stephanie Harvey

item.title: babyhippoface add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Our lives begin to end the day we become silent about things that matter." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: babyhippoface add a quote by Roger Rosenblatt
item.description: "There may be no more pleasing picture in the world than that of a child peering into a book - the past and the future entrancing each other." -- Roger Rosenblatt

item.title: babyhippoface add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "People think it must be fun to be a super genius, but they don't realize how hard it is to put up with all the idiots in the world." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: babyhippoface add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "In my opinion, we don't devote nearly enough scientific research to finding a cure for jerks." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: babyhippoface add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: babyhippoface add a quote by Randy Pausch
item.description: "Experience is what you get when you didn't get what you wanted. And experience is often the most valuable thing you have to offer." -- Randy Pausch

item.title: babyhippoface add a quote by Mason Cooley
item.description: "Reading gives us someplace to go when we have to stay where we are." -- Mason Cooley

item.title: babyhippoface add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Whatever you are, be a good one." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: babyhippoface add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "My concern is not whether God is on our side; my greatest concern is to be on God's side, for God is always right." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: babyhippoface add a quote by Virginia Wolff
item.description: "A good book is never finished—-it goes on whispering to you from the wall." -- Virginia Wolff

item.title: babyhippoface add a quote by Norton Juster
item.description: "What you learn today, for no reason at all, will help you discover all the wonderful secrets of tomorrow." -- Norton Juster

item.title: babyhippoface add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "Do what you feel in your heart to be right – for you’ll be criticized anyway." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: babyhippoface add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "You wouldn't worry so much about what others think of you if you realized how seldom they do." -- Eleanor Roosevelt
